availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas L. Hoglan (Bullitt County, Ky, miller & blacksmith)

body.p: Bullitt County, Kentucky, blacksmith and miller. Kentucky native. Married to Martha A. Hoglan. Father of Mary C. Hoglan, John A. Hoglan, Eliza Hoglan, Rose A. Hoglan, and Charles Hoglan. Blacksmith in Bullitt County, Kentucky, in 1850. Miller in Bullitt County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, p. 185B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, District 1, p. 33.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, Shepherdsville, p. 279A.
